If your puppy keeps crying every night, even after ruling out any immediate needs and providing comfort items, it can be a bit challenging to deal with. However, it is essential not to let them out of their crate, as this can reinforce the crying behavior, and they will expect to be let out every time they cry. Instead, the following tips can help train your puppy to stay in their crate peacefully:

1. Ignore the crying: Ignoring the crying can be a difficult thing to do as a pet owner, but it can help in training your puppy to stay calm in their crate. Try not to react or acknowledge the crying, as it's possible that your puppy is crying for attention.

2. Slowly increase crate time: If your puppy isn't used to staying in their crate for long periods, it's important to start slowly, increasing the time gradually until they're comfortable in their crate. You can start by leaving your puppy in the crate for just a few minutes, then gradually increasing the time.

3. Keep your puppy tired: If your puppy is crying at night, they may have too much energy, which can make it difficult for them to settle down in their crate. Make sure to keep them active during the day, taking walks and playing with them, so they are tired by the evening.

4. Create a bedtime routine: Establishing a bedtime routine can help your puppy settle down and feel more comfortable in their crate. Before putting them in their crate, take them out for a walk, give them a treat or special toy, and use a soothing tone of voice to help them calm down.

5. Use positive reinforcement: When your puppy is quiet in their crate, praise and reward them. This positive reinforcement can help them learn that staying quiet in their crate is rewarding.

With consistent training, most puppies can learn to stay in their crate peacefully at night. If your puppy continues to cry or shows signs of distress, it might be helpful to consult with a professional dog trainer or a veterinarian.
